newsletter.disclaimer: if you want to receive updates on our developments be sure to subscribe to our monthly newsletter!

indep.name: independent
indep.descr: a standalone application to interact with your private keys

secure.name: secure
secure.descr: store your private keys encrypted by AES256 algorithm in the files with privileged access

isolated.name: isolated
isolated.descr: keep your keys in an isolated environment from your browser, DApp and the local storage

friend.name: friendly
friend.descr: the Keychain API easily integrates with any project no matter what language you choose for development

jumbotron.heading: An Open-source Desktop App to Manage Private Keys

features.control: complete control over the sensitive information
features.vault: a vault which never transmits private data
features.storage: easy key management with localhost access

representation.name: representation layer
representation.descr: KeyChain’s UI window allows you to securely create and interact with your keys. It is initiated through the Security layer.

signing.name: signing module
signing.descr: a mezo-structure which interacts with the Security layer and unlocks the keys once the correct passphrase has been given to KeyChain.

security.name: security layer
security.descr: KeyChain’s ace in the sleeve! It provides the safest communication channel between the user and Keychain. It is an OS specific structure and interacts with the system itself without any external exposure.

api.name: API layer
api.descr: a language neutral layer which integrates with your app or website. It transmits and parses commands for a given API through pipes and websocket.

headings.qualities: a perfect solution for blockchain-based projects

paragraphs.about: KeyChain is a standalone app for signing transactions and generating key pairs. It stores private keys in an isolated environment where no keylogger, debugger or spyware can intercept them because of the three-layer security protecting each action of the system. KeyChain supports transactions from and to various blockchains, including Ethereum and Ethereum classic, Litecoin, Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, and Bitshares

qualities.protocol: instead of losing time to build the protocol for storing user’s private keys, use the KeyChain
qualities.code: our code is open-source and available to you now
qualities.offer: offer truly decentralized product for Web.3 and change the world of institutional control

security.about: We look past standard solutions to data protection. As is well-known, the longer the path, the more chances there are of passwords being intercepted. To ensure safe operations in Unix-like OS, we have created a shortcut from you entering a passphrase to the KeyChain processing it. To protect Windows users, we employ the mechanism that allows the processes to run separately without letting any one of them to interfere with another - a technology that is inherent to macOS.

testimonials.question: what did they say about our products?

integration.for_dev: if you are a developer who is ready to give KeyChain a go - take a look at our set of simple guides and documentation  that we have created specially for you.

icoadmin.name: ICOadm.in
icoadmin.about: Superior Software Platform for ICO/STO launch
icoadmin.feedback: A free, open-source application to store private keys? - Yes, we want it! KeyChain helped solve many security dilemmas for our clients.
icoadmin.author: Sabir Magdeev

swap.name: Swap.Online
swap.about: Multi-cryptocurrency wallet powered by Atomic Swaps
swap.feedback: KeyChain is a perfect solution for our project. We can assure our users that their assets are stored safely.
swap.author: Alexander Noxon

jurry.name: Jury.Online
jurry.feedback: KeyChain is incredibly simple to use. No complicated integration processes and no headaches because of  stolen keys.
jurry.author: Igor Mironenko

velvet.name: Velvet.Exchange
velvet.feedback: We wanted to build the exchange which doesn’t store our clients keys. KeyChain solved this issue for us and now we our proud users of it.
velvet.author: Anastasia Chokan
